page.title: 01A General View:Chinnor etc.
page.content: Our block is predominately rural in character. It contains a section of a vastly expanded village-Chinnor. This village lies at the foot of the Chilterns; a possible reason for its growth being cheap and available land for developers during the 1960s. In contrast to this, there are two much smaller villages nearby-Sydenham and Emmington-and also much open cultivated land comprising eleven farms etc. The B4445 road linking Chinnor with Thame runs diagonally N.W.-S.E. across the block. The two small villages, Sydenham by far the larger, depend very much on Chinnor for their everyday needs. Both are within 2km. of Chinnor though private transport is a necessity. The market town of Thame lies about 4km in the opposite direction from Chinnor.
